author: Special Correspondent
text:
Supreme Court Commissioner on Right to Food Harsh Mander has urged the West Bengal government to set up a joint review committee to ensure food security in the tea gardens of north Bengal where food distress has been prevailing for some time.

Mr. Mander has written to State’s Chief Secretary Basudeb Banerjee urging him to take steps to reduce the distress.

“The State government and the SC Commissioners jointly wish to create condition of food security and social protection in the tea gardens . For this, I propose we establish a standing joint review committee for an initial period of one year,” Mr. Mander said in the letter, a copy of which is with The Hindu .
title: West Bengal asked to ensure food security in tea gardens
